intro: Cassipourea belizensis, commonly known as the Belize cassipourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often woody and branched. Cassipourea belizensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
